mechanoreception.notes: As colonial hydrozoans, Stylasteridae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and physical disturbances for feeding and defense.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely used for prey detection and location, as well as potential mate recognition or avoidance of harmful substances.

photoreception.notes: While some hydrozoans have simple eyes, the presence of photoreception in Stylasteridae is unknown. Given their deep-water habitat, it may be reduced or absent in many species, although shallow-water species may retain some light sensitivity.
